Bringing in two of the oldest, but most reputed forex brokers to exist in the industry, we have IC Markets (2007), and Pepperstone (2010).

Starting with the regulation, both have a common regulatory body backing them up ‚Äî ASIC. Individually, IC Markets is regulated with CySEC, FSA, and SCB, meanwhile, Pepperstone is backed with FCA and DFSA. This means that if you are planning to deposit funds with them, which you can do rightfully and safely.

Now, let‚Äôs get into the business of getting to know their trading conditions below.

SPREADS

IC Markets is leading ahead of Pepperstone, in terms of spreads. Thanks to the screenshot taken from myfxbook spreads page.

2. COMMISSIONS

Both IC Markets and Pepperstone charge the same commission, that is, $7/100k RT. Let‚Äôs include both commissions and spreads to the major forex pairs.

Ultimately, IC Markets is leading in this category with taking over all the spots.

3. PAYMENT METHODS

Both the brokers accept multiple deposit and withdrawal methods with multiple credit cards, multiple electronic payment methods, bank wire transfer, local bank transfer, and other payment methods. There are no extra fees charged for withdrawal of funds with both too.

4. MINIMUM DEPOSITS

Both the brokers allow you to deposit starting from 200 USD onwards.

5. SERVICES

There are so many services offered by both brokers which are the cost of zero, including inactivity fees.

Coming to close the chapter, I think it is safe to say that IC Markets is a better choice, in terms of spreads and commission, which is quite favorable as compared to Pepperstone.

Hope this helps in your trading journey in picking the right forex broker.

I‚Äôm feeling a little lost. (that‚Äôs a way of starting a post han?!)

I don‚Äôt know exactly what I want, what I like, what I want to do or accomplish.

I always knew what I wanted. Since my 11th grade in High School I knew what college degree to choose. Since then I knew what I liked and what I wanted to do. I was getting more clarity along the years, of course, but the main thing were there.

It was a little ironic, because at that age everyone is a little lost, not knowing what path to pursue, but not me. I always knew.

Right now, at a age where I was supposed to have things a little more figured out, I don‚Äôt‚Ä¶ Maybe it‚Äôs just destiny doing its things, ou some form of compensation, or just some fase.

We don‚Äôt need to have it all figured out. We don‚Äôt need to plan our lives like a Marketing Plan. We just have to live it. Just like Lilly Aldrin would say to Ted: ‚ÄúYou can design your life like a building, you just have to live it‚Äù.

How can we just live our lives, without designing it or planning it? Well, I don‚Äôt know, but we I find out, I‚Äôll tell you ;)

I will provide a concise draft of the article with the additions you requested. Here it is:

---

**Simplifying Drag and Drop Functionality in Android Apps**

Drag and drop functionality is a powerful tool for enhancing user experience in Android apps. However, integrating this feature can be challenging. The **DragAndDrop** library is currently in **alpha** and is actively being developed. It is essential to note that the library is still under development, and there may be bugs or limitations. We encourage developers to try the alpha version and provide feedback to help improve it.

---

Let me know if you need any further adjustments or if you have additional points you would like to include.
</response>
gts:
At the most basic level, drag and drop is a gesture where a user can tap and hold an image, text string or other data element, then drag it into another app (or to another location in the same app) and release, where the data is incorporated in the new location. This gesture is usually a long press on touch screens or a click and drag when using a mouse.

A simple drag & drop sample.

While Android has long supported drag and drop ( DragEvent was introduced in Android 3.0, API level 11), integrating full support for handling gestures, events, permissions and callbacks has proven to be complex.

Today we‚Äôre introducing the Jetpack DragAndDrop library as an alpha release to make it easier for you to handle data dropped into your app.

Drag and drop is becoming increasingly relevant for large screen form factors: tablet and laptops, but especially also foldables, where split screen is used 7 times as often than on conventional phones. The ability to drag data from one app to another is a natural experience for users as they multitask more efficiently with their apps in split-screen or windowed modes.

While dragging text from EditTexts is supported natively by the platform, we strongly recommend enabling users to drag any images, files or text from other components of your app. Just as importantly, we encourage allowing users to drop data into your apps as well.

Dragging from one app into another.

DropHelper , in combination with DragStartHelper , makes it much easier to take care of gesture support, callbacks, styling and pixel-perfect alignment.

DragStartHelper

DragStartHelper is a utility class in Jetpack core that detects gestures commonly used to start a drag, such as long pressing or click and dragging with a mouse.

DropHelper

The new DropHelper is a utility class that takes care of listeners and drop targets. Be sure to use addInnerEditTexts() when building DropHelper.Options to ensure that any nested EditTexts inside your drop target don‚Äôt acquire focus instead.

Learn more

Read more in the Drag and drop guide on Android Developers, dive into the large screen sample to see DropHelper in practice and then try it out in alpha now to give us feedback.

Thanks to Florina, Ben and Nick!

gts:
Nonprofits and government agencies need nonprofit accounting software to demonstrate accountability and compliance. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into what you need to know in choosing the most compliant software.

A compliant nonprofit accounting software system tracks revenue to a designated purpose and prevents misuse of donations.

If a nonprofit wants to be compliant with GAAP and FASB 116/117, all of their funds must be grouped into two categories of net assets: (1) without donor restrictions and (2) net assets with donor restrictions, which replace the three former categories of unrestricted, temporarily restricted and permanently restricted net assets. To be GAAP-compliant, nonprofits only need two funds to report on the breakdown of net assets on IRS form 990.

Nonprofit Accounting Software Identifies Who, What and Why

In order to fully understand why nonprofits need nonprofit accounting, you need to understand three fundamental questions:

Who is the source of revenue? What is the designated purpose? Why nonprofits need to classify revenue?

1. Who is the source of revenue?

Who identifies the source of revenue and provider of services and expenses. This is know as donor designated revenue. Who is donating or granting funds to the nonprofit? Who is the nonprofit paying expenses, such as salaries, payroll taxes, services, rent, utilities?

gts:
But but blockchain is for criminals‚Ä¶

Too many times have we heard this argument. It is almost a meme by now. It is a bit true, but also a lot wrong. The main issue with blockchain technology is the anonymity of blockchain wallets. Fun fact: Did you know that you can just generate your own blockchain wallet offline? The whole idea behind wallet creation is not that you and only you have access to your wallet only, but that everyone who has the same private key as you also has the same wallet. The ‚Äúsecurity‚Äù only stems from one aspect: Stochastics! Two people have a very very low chance to create the same wallet. For example, MetaMask creates them using 2048 seed words. In total, you need 12 of them to create a wallet. Therefore, there are 204‚Å∏¬π¬≤ possibilities. Does not sound like a lot but this number is equal to 5444517871000000000000000000000000000000000000000. In truth some additional requirements must be satisfied, therefore a lot less combinations exist, but for simplicity we abstract from these here. All of these wallets are therefore entirely anonymous. The only way to know who has access to which address is by creating a mapping between a person‚Äôs real identity and the wallet address they have used for a transaction. Therefore, India could try to force its citizens to only pay from verified wallet addresses. India could force its companies to only accept payments from verified wallets. But, agreeably, there are still plenty of possibilities on how to still exploit the anonymity of blockchain for shady activities. There‚Äôs one crucial aspect to the blockchain though: It keeps a log of every transaction ever executed forever, redundantly backed up on thousands or even millions of servers worldwide. Further, these logs are publicly accessible by everyone at any given time. Blockchain technology can therefore also substantially enhance transparency and reveal monetary flows across the world. It acts as an ultimate threat: Yes, you can engage in illegal transactions, but should your wallet address ever become traceable back to you, even if only by accident, everyone can see what you‚Äôve done. Therefore, India should not ban ‚Äúprivate‚Äù (i.e.. ‚Äúdecentralized‚Äù) blockchains, but rather embrace them and build systems around them to enhance both their transparency and security.

Personal Finance

Don‚Äôt Cosign A Loan, Don‚Äôt Bet On A Losing Horse

Photo by DDP on Unsplash

Worried about cosigning a loan for someone in need? To help you make the decision easier, remember that people who require cosigners often miss payments and have poor credit. They have a history that depicts poor financial decision-making.

The reason people need a cosign is because they can‚Äôt do it alone without your help; they need you. The question is, are you willing to take a chance on the Detroit Lions, whose record is 2 wins-12 losses-1 tie. I wouldn‚Äôt.

Yes, we take risks when we make investments, but consigning a loan is not the same thing ‚Äî it‚Äôs entirely different. You‚Äôre investing in someone who has already shown you a record of failing financials. In the startup world, this is a major red flag.

Choosing not to help your best friend or sibling get a new car, take out a personal loan, or get a credit card is disheartening ‚Äî especially if you have the means to help.

What happens if they start missing payments? What happens if they decide they can‚Äôt make any payments and you‚Äôre stuck with the payments? Will you be okay with that?

AR Rahman's music, however, elevates the experience. The subplot on mental health is oversimplified and poorly resolved, given Dhanush's character as a doctor. The film mishandles the topic, which is a significant flaw.
</response>
gts:
I hate Dhanush‚Äôs forced humility off screen for obvious reasons but Dhanush on screen is a powerhouse performer. "Atrangi Re" is another testimony to his outstanding acting ability. He makes you laugh when he laughs, he makes you cry when he cries. He is such a terrific actor.

As revealed in the trailer, the movie is about a forced marriage and the aftermath the couple face because of the same. The movie has an interesting plot that can make anyone say "wow" but the screenplay lacks big-time. The movie as a whole was a middling affair that solely relies on performance of the actors.

Sara Ali Khan played her character to perfect while Akshay Kumar was just decent. ARR is the hero behind the screens for the movie. His songs and soulful BGM is what promotes the movie from being average to decent/good. Particularly loved the "Little Little" sequence in the movie. Imo, the best 10 minutes in the movie.

The movie has equal shortcomings to that of the positives. The lack of engaging screenplay, irking logical loopholes, stereotyping tamils(though it's not new in a Bollywood movie, the entire Tamilnadu sequence was a turn off) and inadequate character background are some of the shortcomings of the movie. It's as if the director who wrote terrific first half didn't know how to end the movie in second half.

~Overall, a decent movie that falls short in the latter half. Watch it for Dhanush and AR Rahman.

P.S. : There is some serious ill handled mental issue concept that is sure to stir up arguments in the coming days. Dhanush being a doctor in the movie, it was baffling the way it was treated in the movie.

gts:
DSP Technology for Middle-market Brands

DSP Technology for Middle-market Brands

Brittany Wray shares insights on programmatic advertising and its influence on marketing. She highlights the outcomes derived from the said technique creating a win-win situation for all. If you look at most leading indicators for programmatic digital advertising, the trends point steadily upwards with DSP Technology for Middle-market Brands. The latest forecast from eMarketer projects that marketers will spend more dollars on programmatic ($133B), that it will account for a greater share of the media mix (91%), and that a growing and increasingly premium share of available inventory will be transacted programmatically.

It‚Äôs Only Middlemen for The Middle Market ‚Äî Major brands and agencies have long mastered the ins and outs of programmatic tech. Reading the industry trades, one could easily assume that the vast majority of advertisers have followed suit. The simple reason is that they don‚Äôt spend enough money on their own to meet the minimums for leading DSPs like MediaMath and The Trade Desk. These arbitrary minimums have excluded the majority of advertisers from the programmatic advertising technology.

It‚Äôs a lost opportunity for everyone. These budget minimums have limited the middle market‚Äôs autonomy and curtailed its ability to bring advertising operations under their own control. They have disincentivized these companies from developing the talent and budgeting the resources necessary to master this technology and get the most value from it. And they have kept the major DSPs from accessing the largest, most diversified, and therefore most durable segment of advertisers. Instead, middle market companies rely on media agencies (like my company, AudienceX) to manage their digital budgets, essentially acting as surrogate operators of this DSP technology. On the surface, that would seem to benefit digital agencies like us, but in the long run I‚Äôm not sure it benefits anyone.

For more such updates, check Out recent Martech Cube guest blogs.

gts:
Repossession, produced, written and directed by Ming Siu Goh and Scott C. Hillyard, will see a North America release via Digital on Tuesday, 21 December 2021. The film, seen at various film festivals including Cinequest Film Festival, Dances With Films Festival, and the Singapore Chinese Film Festival, garnered much positive feedback.

Video Credit: Film Threat

The horror film, distributed by Gravitas Ventures and Kamikaze Dogfight, revolves around 50-year-old Jim. Jim has managed to construct for himself a perfect life in the world‚Äôs most expensive city. Curiously, when Jim is unexpectedly laid off, he desperately clings onto the symbols of his success. Not long thereafter, plauged by his past, we find Jim wrestling with resurfacing demons.

Repossession, frequently compared to Jordan Peele‚Äôs Get Out (2017) and Bong Joon Ho‚Äôs Parasite (2019), stars Gerald Chew as Jim. Chew‚Äôs previous work includes The Tattooist (2007), Apprentice (2016), and Wonder Boy (2017). More recently, playing Tommy ‚ÄòThe Scorpion‚Äô Chow, the actor could be seen in the Dean Devlin/Gary Rosen co-created television series Almost Paradise.

Video Credit: Cinequest

Further to Chew, playing supporting characters, Repossession also stars Amy Cheng, Sivakumar Palakrishnan, Rachel Wan, Matthew Loo, Ming Siu Goh, and Scott C. Hillyard. Repossession, with Siang Seng Goh, Alex Low and Mun Yang Tham serving as co-producers, comes to Digital on Tuesday, 21 December 2021.

gts:
Marketing illustrations by Storyset

Working from home has numerous advantages, but also comes with its disadvantages.

Building a successful online business is a dream come true for many people around the world, though to some, it is not always fun and games.

Sources have it that you can survive on online businesses and enjoy the freedom of earning real money from your passions.

As earlier mentioned, running an online business is not always a walk in the park, and therefore it is wise not to underestimate the hard work that a successful online business requires.

To understand what it entails to run an online business, let us take a look at the Benefits and Costs of running online businesses.

Benefits of Running an Online Business

1) Flexible schedule and rules.

Owning an online job allows you to create your rules and be your boss. With the flexibility that comes with self-employment, one can even create time to see friends and family.

2) Low startup costs.

One key benefit of owning an online business is the low starting cost. Sources have it that you can start a website with less than $100, and as your business grows, you can invest more in it. An online business gives you the liberty of working from your house and requires no leasing costs. You do not have to worry about an employee‚Äôs salary too!

3) You become the boss.

Running your own online business gives you the mandate of setting the rules and regulations. Nobody tells you what to do, and you get an opportunity of controlling your destiny. You get to make decisions about marketing, product or service development, customer service, and pretty much everything related to your business.

Cost of Running an Online Business

1) Long working hours

For any business to succeed, it calls for hard work and long working hours. Starting an online job from scratch takes a good amount of time to be successful and in some cases, people are required to work on weekends to reach their targets.

2) Requires a lot of discipline.

With all the freedom that comes with running your own business, discipline is fundamental. The time one takes for breaks should be limited, and more focus should be made to reach the set target.

gts:
Just a few days ago Hillary Clinton expressed her opinions on cryptocurrency‚Ä¶ Spoiler alert, she is not a fan of cryptocurrencies for a variety of reasons. However her concerns raise valid questions that pose answers we could all learn from.

Understanding the technology behind crypto is critical to making smarter investment decisions. Become a blockchain ninja today!

Traditional Currencies Will Suffer

One of Hillary‚Äôs main concerns were that cryptocurrency will eventually become too widespread. The most prominent issue that could arise from a widespread transition to crypto, is the potential for traditional currencies to seize in place of cryptocurrencies. This doesn't sound too awful at first, however this transition could spark a chain reaction that disrupts the economy of entire countries.

Economies Will Suffer

The problem becomes much more serious, if in theory cryptocurrency effectively becomes the norm putting traditional currencies in the back seat. The adoption to cryptocurrency has come at alarming rates, and many countries are already struggling to figure out how to keep up. While countries like El Salvador have adjusted to the crypto evolution quite fast, by building a Bitcoin city. Many smaller countries with less stable economies could potentially suffer the most if they are unable to come up with a valid solution.

Security Concerns

Many people fear that having large portions of a country‚Äôs wealth stored in crypto could be a security risk for getting hacked. This is certainly a valid concern with many data leaks and interferences by foreign nations already being quite prevalent. With crypto there is even more incentive for hackers because they could directly impact the economy of an entire country.

Conclusion

It is difficult to say which concerns are the most valid, and what issues deserve the most attention. However many of these crucial questions remain unanswered, the answers to these questoins will only come with time.

One More Thing

If you enjoyed this article, please consider following me on Twitter: @natexlee.

gts:
WhatsApp has announced the introduction of a payment service based on the Novi wallet. Users will be able to send and receive USDP, a stablecoin from Paxos.

WhatsApp launches cryptocurrency payment service

As a reminder, WhatsApp is part of the Meta/Facebook group, so the integration of Novi is not particularly a surprise. The news was announced by Stephane Kasriel, the new CEO of Novi who replaces David Marcus, the latter having announced his departure a few days ago.

The Novi wallet, was developed in parallel with Diem, the cryptocurrency initially carried by Facebook. But it is the wallet that seems to have taken center stage: it was launched six weeks ago and is based on USDP: a stablecoin from Paxos backed by the dollar. It, too, has changed its name ‚Äî it was once called PAX.

Payments in USDP directly from conversations

This is the payment solution that has just been integrated into WhatsApp, for users located in the United States. According to the official website of the project, they can now access the sending of funds directly from the conversation, as if they were sending an attachment.

Moreover, there are no sending or receiving fees, and it is possible to transfer the amount to their bank account. According to the release, payments are sent instantly from one participant to another.

Stephane Kasriel confirmed that the functionality would eventually be opened to other countries:

‚ÄúThe Novi pilot is still in its very early stages, so we made the decision to test this new entry point in one country to begin with, and we will expand it once we get feedback from users.‚Äù

Diem is fading?

The shift in the payment service is now particularly visible. The cryptocurrency, which until recently was called Libra, keeps running into limitations. The regulators show their teeth as soon as Diem takes a step in its development, and this despite a calculated distancing from Facebook and Mark Zuckerberg.

Before leaving the project, David Marcus had stated that the company intended to offer Diem eventually, and to integrate it with Novi. The choice of Paxos‚Äô USDT had indeed been a way to rely on an existing cryptocurrency, and therefore less likely to trigger an outcry.

But in reality, Diem seems to be off to a bad start, and one wonders if Meta will finally manage to spread this cryptocurrency, which has been mutating ever since its 2019 launch was announced.

The assistant is designed to be helpful, proactive, and highly interactive.

The assistant strives to accurately interpret the user's intent throughout the conversation, acknowledging previous interactions to maintain context and continuity. If the user's message is unclear or lacks necessary details, the assistant always asks for clarification rather than making assumptions. For example, if the user's request is incomplete, the assistant responds with: "Could you provide more details so I can assist you better?"

The assistant asks specific follow-up questions and offers suggestions based on the user's needs, avoiding vague or generic prompts. It proactively provides guidance and potential next steps, especially in complex tasks such as writing, analysis, coding, and question answering.

The assistant is mindful of how much content the user needs to read or type, keeping interactions concise and efficient. It reduces unnecessary repetition and ensures responses are relevant, well-structured, and free from errors. When presenting options or asking for feedback, the assistant simplifies interactions by offering multiple-choice answers or specific suggestions to make it easier for the user to respond quickly.

The assistant adapts its tone to align with the user's emotional state and style, adjusting its approach as needed. If uncertain about something, the assistant honestly says, "I don't know," and suggests ways for the user to find the information.

The assistant provides factually accurate, coherent, and relevant responses, using proper grammar and structure. It remains interactive and proactive across all tasks, continually seeking feedback to refine and improve interactions.

Oral hygiene products are crucial in maintaining your dental health and improving your smile. Numerous dental care products in the market can overwhelm you when choosing what to buy. Here are seven oral health products you need.

Toothbrushes

Toothbrushes are available in numerous brands and types, including electric and traditional. A toothbrush with soft bristles is preferable since it‚Äôs not abrasive on your gums. You can opt for an electric toothbrush such as the Oral-B iO Series 9 Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush. This model comes with Bluetooth compatibility that monitors your brushing habits. It also has a sensor that warns you when brushing too hard.

Dental Floss

Flossing helps your teeth to remain healthy, and you should floss at least once a day. It helps to remove food particles between your teeth and prevent tooth decay and reduce plaque. With various flossing products, you can go for Quip The Floss that comes in a refillable metallic dispenser. The string is marked at 18 inches which is the ideal length to reach every tooth.

Oral Irrigators

Oral irrigators help to shoot a steady stream of water to remove food particles between the teeth. Smile Direct Club Water Flosser helps you deep clean and remove plaque between teeth. It is ideal for people with braces as the water removes particles from hard-to-reach places.

Toothpaste

When buying toothpaste, choose one that contains fluoride as it helps to strengthen your teeth and protects them from decay. Colgate Optic White Renewal toothpaste contains hydrogen peroxide and fluoride that helps to whiten and strengthen your teeth.

Mouthwash

Mouthwash helps to reduce plaque, fight cavities and prevent gingivitis. Hello Naturally Fresh Antiseptic Mouthwash helps to give you fresh breath and kills germs. It‚Äôs a natural antiseptic that has a mint and peppermint that enhances its smell and taste.

Stain Wipes

Stain prevention wipes help to brighten your teeth and fight bad breath. Moon Stain Prevention Teeth Wipes help to remove stains from your teeth for a brighter smile. It contains peppermint for a fresh breath and cranberry fruit that helps to whiten teeth.

Tongue Cleaners

Cleaning your tongue helps to remove bacteria in your mouth and remove plaque. It improves your oral hygiene and prevents bad breath. Dr. Tungs Tongue Cleaner is a fantastic product that removes food debris and dead skin cells from your tongue.

What is the best way to get leads online?

How do you get more sales leads online? Getting your business into the minds of potential customers, especially if you‚Äôre an e-commerce company, can be tricky ‚Äî but not impossible. Here are 3 ways you can generate more sales leads online. 1) E-mail Marketing: Create an email list of people who want to hear from you, and start sending out emails on a regular basis with tips and advice that are relevant to their needs and interests. Just be sure not to abuse their inboxes!

1) LinkedIn

LinkedIn is a great place to network and connect with other professionals. While you can use LinkedIn‚Äôs network to find new leads, as a marketing tool, it still leaves something to be desired in terms of ease of use. If you already have a personal profile on LinkedIn, there are a few tricks that you can use to make networking easier. Use these tips to get more out of your time on LinkedIn

2) Google+

While many businesses might think of social media as just a place to share pictures and updates, Google+ is so much more. Unlike other networks like Facebook or Twitter, Google+ is truly focused on creating an online community, where people can discuss their passions and find like-minded people. To create your ideal sales leads online, you must create content that‚Äôs valuable to these users and connect with them in ways that let them know you care about what they have to say.

3) Facebook

If you have a Facebook page for your business, it‚Äôs a great idea to post frequently so that people stay up-to-date on new promotions or products. People will be more likely to buy from you if they trust that you are always offering new and exciting things, and since Facebook has become one of the most popular social media platforms in recent years, it‚Äôs a great way to gain exposure.

Filter on the name

Filtering on the name goes via a controller; the type of filter inherently part of the table view. You only see what matches. To get a match we use a column containing the full name (thus first name and last name put together). The function Lower() is applied to flatten out capitals and the function Find() to check if the string appears in the column. Details on the Find function in this blog. All we need to remember is that in case the position is greater than 0 (>0) the name (partly) exists. The name(s) that fit the search appear and you keep on typing until one full name is left.

Confirm a match

Once you have a possible match (the find functions outputs a value greater than 1) you should be able to check this guest so it leaves the list of attendees yet to come.

The formula logic to indicate the match is not complicated, see below.

The visual trick is to create a canvas formula that shows results and when nothing is found or when the search box is empty, the formula results in a close to invisible light grey box, see below:

However, we have to take the logic one step further to make it possible to confirm the presence. We solve the issue by using the same button to confirm the guest and to ‚Äî if necessary ‚Äî add a new guest to the list. This goes in two steps:

First, we check if there is only one name and if so we start filtering on this name and we use ModifyRows() as you see below.

The If statement also tells us what to do if there is no match. Please note that the user has to make sure that only one name comes up. Later on in the process, we‚Äôll solve possible human errors by deleting rows that do not contain a first or last name. Below the code to avoid incomplete records.

[DB GuestList].Filter(Firstname.IsBlank() or Lastname.IsBlank()).Formulamap(DeleteRows(CurrentValue))

So far we have the solution to check a guest. Next we show how to add a guest in case we have no match.

Add a new guest

Adding a new quest requires we fill out a form or something that looks like a form. Here we use the full screen option and we trigger this option under certain conditions. First we add the name to the column Firstname and second we open the row that contains this first name.

gts:
Speak Spanish From Day One.

The first thing I discovered upon my arrival in Caracas was that I remembered much less Spanish than I thought I did. As it had been over five years since I had taken a Spanish course I guess I really shouldn‚Äôt have been surprised right? Who can really expect to remember much from a high school course that was mediocre at best? As I tried desperately to order a simple sandwich and something to drink, I realized that if I didn‚Äôt at least attempt to learn Spanish I would most likely starve after a week or so.

How exactly does one go about learning Spanish in a Latin American country? Seems pretty easy right? Well, I assure you it is not, especially when your entire day is spent speaking English. Another obstacle that I quickly encountered was the very rapid way in which everyone speaks in this city. It is amazing how a sentence containing 10 words or so can come out sounding almost like one long word. Is that what English sounds like to people who don‚Äôt speak English? It is exceedingly difficult to learn words in another language when you are unable to decipher exactly where one word ends and another begins. This process is made even harder by the fact that most people here fail to pronounce the whole word anyway. There were many words that I was convinced I knew and was using quite frequently. Imagine my dismay when I found out they had whole other syllables on the end of the word. No wonder I had been getting funny looks from people on the street and in restaurants.

I eventually came to the conclusion that an actual course was needed or even better, a private tutor of some sort. The only way I was ever going to learn Spanish was by actually sitting down and studying with someone who could answer the myriad of questions that arose every day. Sad isn‚Äôt it? Here I sit, living in a Latin American country and I am unable to pick up the language without resorting to private lessons. Some people seem to have an ear for languages and can pick them up simply by listening, too bad I will never be one of those people.

ACCESS SPANISH LANGUAGE COURSES RIGHT NOW

gts:
1. Increasing physical activity

The more energy a person expends throughout the day, the more food they require as fuel.

Exercise aids in the depletion of glycogen stores in the body. When a person consumes carbohydrates, their glycogen stores are refilled in the majority of cases. When someone follows a low-carb diet, their glycogen stores are not replenished.

It may take some time for the body to adjust to relying on fat stores rather than glucose. As the body adjusts, a person may become tired.

2. Significantly reducing carbohydrate intake

Ketosis occurs when the body is deprived of carbohydrates and must rely on fat for energy instead of sugar.

If you want to lose weight, lower your risk of heart disease, or maintain and control your blood sugar levels, you should limit your carb intake to 20 grams (g) per day or fewer.

This is not, however, a fixed figure. Some people may be able to consume more carbohydrate while being in ketosis, while others would require less.

3. Fasting for short periods

Fasting, or going without eating for a period of time, can assist in achieving ketosis. Many people can fall into ketosis without eating anything.

A doctor may recommend a lengthier fasting time of between 24 and 48 hours in specific regulated instances. Before fasting for more than a few hours at a time, a person should consult with their doctor.

Fat fasting is a different type of fasting. Fat fasting entails drastically lowering calorie intake and eating a nearly fat-only diet for no more than two or three days.

preliminary research

According to Trusted Source, this could help with weight loss. Fat fasting, on the other hand, is difficult to sustain and may not be the ideal option for the majority of people.

People should be cautious about using this strategy because of the tiny sample sizes and lack of more substantial data.

In our fleet we have Semi-trailers, Frigo-trailers, Tilt Truck, Panel Van and Mini Van. We also have a Semi ‚Äî trailers with various upgrades, Truck-Trailers ( Tandem Truck ), and Panel Van available for 5, 6 and 7 paletes to meet the specific requirements of our customers.

Thanks to a years long experience of our expert staff willing to give trouble-free services to our clients, Maxi Logistics Services has become a regional leader in the transport sector. Permanent quality control of our services, unique to the whole company, helps us to surpass our customer expectations.

gts:
Whether you exchange messages with friends who speak different languages, shop online on international websites, or just need to translate the content for research purposes, the chances are, that in one way or another, you used machine translations at some point. In many cases, these tools are doing their jobs automatically, enabling you to communicate across borders by using foreign languages with confidence.

As we live in an interconnected world, the need for translation has increased exponentially. In the last 10 years, the global language services market has seen rapid growth, virtually doubling in size. In 2019, it was evaluated at $49.6 billion and it‚Äôs forecasting to reach $56.18 billion by the end of 2021.

However, when comparing the number of words translated daily, you would see it grew that from an average rate of just 2.000 words almost fifty years ago to 10.000 words today. This increase is a result of using an extensive range of machine translation software and special tools that are available nowadays. Algorithms and artificial intelligence help to continuously improve machine translation and process quickly large volumes of text.

But the main question is:

Can Artificial Intelligence replace completely human translation?

Well, the answer is neither simple nor easy. When the text is simple and clear, machine translation services can replace human linguists and provide good translations immediately. But for the complex texts, translation of sensitive data, business communication, and other professional translations, artificial intelligence translation tools are not a good enough alternative to specialized human translators.

But as many people rely on translation tools, let‚Äôs take a closer look at several machine translation services, their benefits, and limitations. This way, you can decide which translation software fits better to your needs, when you should consider professional translation made by a specialized human translator and when you can rely just on the AI.

Regardless of what you see in the movies, most lawsuits are boring and tedious, with hundreds of details that must be dealt with before you may see a resolution. Most people aren‚Äôt familiar with the steps and complexities involved with personal injury claims. Although each personal injury case is different, there are general stages within each case that your personal injury lawyers in Ottawa can guide you through.

Typical Steps in a Personal Injury Lawsuit

If you are injured through someone‚Äôs negligence, the first step is to get medical treatment. Following that, you may want to discuss your claim with a personal injury attorney who can provide you with legal advice about your claim and take you through the process. Working with your Ottawa personal injury law firm, you can expect these stages:

Your attorney will need to gather evidence that supports your claim. You may be asked to gather documentation pertaining to lost wages or medical bills. Your attorney may send you to experts for exams and assessments.

Your lawyer will open negotiations with the insurance company of the other party.

Your case may settle out of court. Your attorney will let you know of any settlement that the insurance company offers. You decide whether you want to accept or not.

Filing a lawsuit in court if you cannot reach a settlement.

Waiting as the case progresses through the pretrial phases.

The case may go to mediation before you have an actual trial.

The trial and verdict.

Experienced Personal Injury Lawyers in Ottawa

Personal injury law is complex. Personal injury claims can take many months, even years to go through the various steps. Your attorney will explain each one and make sure you are doing everything you can to get a positive outcome. Contact a personal injury law firm in Ottawa to get started with your claim in a timely manner and get maximum compensation.

gts:
2021 is coming to a close, and over the last twelve months we‚Äôve released some really cool videos on our YouTube channel. We‚Äôve drawn inspiration from your favorite movies, tv shows, and video games, as well as told some compelling stories and highlighted some of nature‚Äôs most beautiful marvels. We thought it‚Äôd be a good time to look back at some of our favorite videos from this year. Check them out below!

1,000,000 Dollar Gems

Ever wonder what 1 million dollars-worth of gem specimens looks like? In this unboxing video we take a look at some of JTV‚Äôs most valuable specimens. Tanzanite and black opal are the stars, but we won‚Äôt spoil the rest. You‚Äôll have to see for yourself!

Geode Cutting Amethyst

We can all agree that geodes are one of the coolest geologic formations on earth, right? They‚Äôre like nature‚Äôs Easter eggs! We‚Äôve cracked geodes on the channel before, but this one was so be we had to saw it in half! Come see the glittering reveal of what‚Äôs inside this massive amethyst cathedral.

Unboxing Moldavite

If there ever was an example of beauty being born out of destruction, it would have to be moldavite. A colossal meteor impact is what created moldavite, and in this video we unbox a collection of the finest variety of moldavite, Angel Chimes! Watch to see why they‚Äôre named so.

Snakestone

Many cultures around the world combine gems and beasts in their stories. One animal commonly associated with gemstones is the serpent, or snake. From Biblical stories to Native American ones, come explore some of the myth, and truth, about Snakestones!

Brand New Rare Specimens

We here at JTV love the holidays, and we think one of the best ways to celebrate is by treating yourself, so that‚Äôs exactly what we did! We recently acquired some new specimens to display, and we thought we‚Äôd share them with you to round out the year and holiday season. Come share in our excitement!

It‚Äôs been a great year for our YouTube channel, and we have another brand new year to look forward to! There are loads of fascinating and stunning gem and mineral videos coming your way, so don‚Äôt forget to subscribe to our channel so you don‚Äôt miss out on what 2022 has to offer.

‚Äì Rob

gts:
Petty Cash Book in Accounting -In every organization a Petty Cash Book is maintained by many small payments such as conveyance, cartage, postage, telegrams, and other expenses (collectively recorded under miscellaneous expenses) are made. These are generally repetitive in nature. If all these payments are handled by the cashier and are recorded in the main cash book, the procedure is found to be very cumbersome. The cashier may be overburdened, and the cash book may become very bulky.

To avoid this, large organizations normally appoint one more cashier (petty cashier) and maintain a separate cash book to record these transactions. Such a cash book maintained by the petty cashier is called a petty cash book in accounting.

The petty cashier works on the Imprest system. Under this system, a definite sum, say Rs. 2,000 is given to the petty cashier at the start of a particular period. This amount is called the imprest amount. The petty cashier goes on making all small payments out of this imprest amount and when he has spent the substantial portion of the imprest amount say Rs.1,780, he gets reimbursement of the quantity spent from the top cashier.

In the Petty Cash Book in Accounting payment side (credit) besides the first amount column. Each of the numbers columns is allotted for items of specific payments, which are commonest. The last amount column is designated as ‚ÄòMiscellaneous‚Äô followed by a ‚ÄòRemarks‚Äô column. In the miscellaneous column, those payments are recorded that a separate column doesn‚Äôt exist. In the ‚ÄòRemarks‚Äô the character of payment is recorded. At the top of the amount, all amount columns are calculated. The total amount column l shows the entire amount spent and to be reimbursed. On the receipt (debit) side, there‚Äôs just one amount column. Columns for the date, voucher number, and particulars are common for both receipts and payments.

Petty Cash Book

For more details please visit: https://www.manishco.com/petty-cash-book-in-accounting/

gts:
Export collection from DB A

A is an example of DB name

open the terminal and type. For clarification on the commands type mongoexport ‚Äî ‚Äî help on the terminal

Instance 1.

When the DB is not local and it has credentials. edit all the fields in bold.

sudo mongoexport --host=your_IP --port=port --username=your_username --password=your_pwd --forceTableScan --db your_db --collection your_collection --type json --out name_of_json.json

Example:

sudo mongoexport --host=182.158.10.1 --port=2987 --username=mercy --password=mercy_pwd --forceTableScan --db UsersDB --collection Users --type json --out Users.json ///to specify your path

/Downloads/Users.json

Instance 2.

When the DB is local and it has no credentials. edit all the fields in bold. You remove the credential if they don‚Äôt exist and change Ip to localhost.

sudo mongoexport --host=localhost --port=2987 --forceTableScan --db UsersDB --collection Users --type json --out Users.json

N.B don‚Äôt forget to change the port

To view your document, just check on your present working directory. Type pwd on the terminal.

Import collection from DB A to DB B

If you using what we exported above or another file, both cases are the same just place the file in your present working directory or you can specify path as the case of instance one above.

Instance one with hosted and secured DB

sudo mongoimport --host=IP --port=your_port --db your_Db --collection your_collection --file name_of_the_file_you_want_to_import.json

Example

sudo mongoimport --host=182.158.10.1 --port=3444 --db SuppliersBD --collection Users --file Users.json

N.B if it is authenticated add password and username

--username=mercy --password=mercy_pwd

Instance 2.

Importing from a local insecured(if it is secured, add password as above)

sudo mongoimport --host=localhost --port=3444 --db DBName --collection Users --file Users.json

Hope this helps.

Happy coding!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

gts:
If your business offers customers the ability to prepay for services, the accounting process for your revenue gets an additional layer of complexity added to it.

Your accounting treatment will vary slightly depending on the circumstances, but I will outline the basics below.

Subscriptions

If you offer subscriptions to your customers, such as monthly yard maintenance, car washing, dog walking or if you operate a SaaS business, you fall into this category.

Let‚Äôs make the assumption that you offer your customers the ability to prepay for a year‚Äôs worth of services. We will also assume that the yearly cost for your subscription services is $1,200.

The basic journal entry to record the cash sale is straight forward:

Dr. Cash $1,200

Cr. Deferred revenue $1,200

You‚Äôll notice that this gets posted to Deferred Revenue, not your typical revenue account. This is because you have not earned the revenue, so GAAP does not allow you to recognize it (not yet, anyway. You will!). Note that Deferred Revenue is a liability account. This is because you are holding cash that technically does not belong to you yet. Think of it almost like a loan from your customer.

At the end of each month, after you have performed the service, you will get the recognize the proportional amount of the revenue. In our example of a yearly subscription, this will be 1/12th each month.

The monthly journal entry would be:

Dr. Deferred Revenue $100

Cr. Revenue $100

What you are effectively doing is recognizing $100 worth of revenue and reducing your liability, Deferred Revenue.

At the end of the 12 months, you would have made 12 monthly entries totaling $1,200 hitting revenue and removing $1,200 from deferred revenue, leaving you with a $0 liability.

You can follow this process no matter how long the prepayment period. For instance, you can sell 3 years worth of services at once ‚Äî you‚Äôd simply switch the period you recognize the revenue over 36 month instead of 12 month.

Still have questions? Leave a comment below!

gts:
Festival of Christmas comes to chapel

By Talia McWright, writer

Ben Schultz stomped his right foot as the spotlight landed on him. The stage covered in Christmas garland wrapped in red, blue and gold lights. A steady one-two beat from his shoes, and he began singing as more lights illuminated him. The choir joined in stomping, singing and swaying in unison.

Seats in the auditorium of Bethel University‚Äôs Benson Great Hall filled quickly as people came to watch Bethel‚Äôs student choir groups perform songs from the Festival of Christmas Friday morning. Festival of Christmas had been held Thursday night in Benson, and a smaller version of the festival was put on during chapel time for those who missed the performance, or simply wanted to see it again. The sounds of violin, flute and drums could be heard alongside the students singing. Resident director of North, Ryan Hour came with two other Bethel students to watch the performance, since they couldn‚Äôt make it Thursday night.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs so cool to see everyone using their gifts,‚Äù said Ryan Hour, resident director of North. ‚ÄúFrom the vocalists to the orchestra, it‚Äôs all very special.‚Äù

Students left Benson just as quickly as they arrived heading back to classes. A not so normal chapel experience with music replacing the usual preaching, but an experience that set the tone for the upcoming holiday break.

‚ÄúThe overall feeling of this event was a wonderful Christmas time,‚Äù Mackenzie Wondra, junior at Bethel said.

Photo by Talia McWright

‚ÄúThis whole production, this whole day, has just been beyond words,‚Äù ‚Äî Karen, from Wisconsin.

Traveling 362 miles from Kenosha Wisconsin, Karen and her family visited campus to see harpist Cathy Victorsen with the intention of buying her CDs, but stayed for the entire festival of Christmas performance, face covered in tears, moved by the students‚Äô voices. Karen and her family were most moved by Kristiana Marks leading all musicians in Go Tell It On The Mountain.

‚ÄúThis whole production, this whole day, has just been beyond words,‚Äù Karen said.

gts:
3 innovation and digital news in 1 minute. Every Monday. Episode 275

News 1. Pizza but made by a robot

Pazzi is an autonomous pizzeria in Paris with another location in Serris in the East of Paris. They call themselves the world‚Äôs first autonomous restaurant. Customers order on a self order terminal which allows them to customise the exact toppings of the pizza. The robot arms then prepare the dough, add the sauce and toppings, put the pizza in the oven and cut it in front of your eyes. If you also ordered a drink you‚Äôll get that from a vending machine. Opinion: Pazzi is an excitable example of how a human task can be automated. There is a large team behind it, so we expect to see more of these restaurants in the near future.

A not even that simple task is automated by a robot arm, fun to watch Pazzi make Pizza!

News 2.Click & Collect but cool

Delipop launched a pick up location for groceries in cooperation with Carrefour in October. To use its service, customers have to order groceries in Carrefour Drive and set the Delipop store as the pick up location. Customers can pick up their orders the same day if ordered in the morning or next day if ordered later during the day. Customers get an access code to enter the colourful Delipop pick-up store. Opinion: Delipop aggregates orders and thus operates at significant lower cost compared to ultra-fast deliveries. At the same time the fresh and modern designed pick-up stores can keep up with the coolness-factor of Gorillas.

A hip and cool pick-up store for groceries, we hope to see more of these around Europe‚Äôs neighbourhoods.

News 3. ‚ÄúAlmost Just Walk Out‚Äù but more practical

Carrefour launched their new, first of its kind, autonomous store ‚ÄúCarrefour Flash 10/10‚Äù in Paris at the end of November. Utilising cameras and scales the store tracks the products taken and customers just have to pay ‚Äî no scanning needed. Opinion: Compared to ‚ÄúJust Walk Out‚Äù technology, customers still have to pay manually. However they don‚Äôt need to download an app and register before before shopping. This makes this store more practical to use for a larger audience.

Convenient, no download of an app required.

Bringing in two of the oldest, but most reputed forex brokers to exist in the industry, we have IC Markets (2007), and Pepperstone (2010).

Starting with the regulation, both have a common regulatory body backing them up ‚Äî ASIC. Individually, IC Markets is regulated with CySEC, FSA, and SCB, meanwhile, Pepperstone is backed with FCA and DFSA. This means that if you are planning to deposit funds with them, which you can do rightfully and safely.

Now, let‚Äôs get into the business of getting to know their trading conditions below.

SPREADS

IC Markets is leading ahead of Pepperstone, in terms of spreads. Thanks to the screenshot taken from myfxbook spreads page.

2. COMMISSIONS

Both IC Markets and Pepperstone charge the same commission, that is, $7/100k RT. Let‚Äôs include both commissions and spreads to the major forex pairs.

Ultimately, IC Markets is leading in this category with taking over all the spots.

3. PAYMENT METHODS

Both the brokers accept multiple deposit and withdrawal methods with multiple credit cards, multiple electronic payment methods, bank wire transfer, local bank transfer, and other payment methods. There are no extra fees charged for withdrawal of funds with both too.

4. MINIMUM DEPOSITS

Both the brokers allow you to deposit starting from 200 USD onwards.

5. SERVICES

There are so many services offered by both brokers which are the cost of zero, including inactivity fees.

Coming to close the chapter, I think it is safe to say that IC Markets is a better choice, in terms of spreads and commission, which is quite favorable as compared to Pepperstone.

Hope this helps in your trading journey in picking the right forex broker.

To get the most out of strength training, you must ensure that your hard (heavy) sets are hard enough and produce high levels of tension in your muscles.

This is easy to do. Here‚Äôs how it works in the program in my new book Muscle for Life:

End all hard sets of bodyweight exercises 1 rep shy of muscle failure, which is the point where you fail to complete a rep. That is, continue hard sets of bodyweight exercises until you feel you have 0 good reps left in the tank.

End all hard sets of machine, dumbbell, and barbell exercises 2 to 3 reps shy of muscle failure (1 to 2 good reps left).

And how do you gauge this accurately and know how close you are to muscle failure?

It‚Äôs mostly a matter of trial and error, but once you get underway, you‚Äôll quickly become attuned to how your form is holding up.

An easy way to develop this intuition is, as you‚Äôre approaching the end of a hard set, to ask yourself, ‚ÄúIf I absolutely had to, how many more reps could I get with good form?‚Äù

Your instinctive answer will often be accurate, especially as you become more experienced.

Why not go right up to the point of muscle failure?

Mostly because it‚Äôs unnecessary for gaining muscle and strength and increases the risk of injury. As our muscles become fatigued, we can lose the ability to feel what we‚Äôre doing with our body and think we‚Äôre maintaining good form when we‚Äôre not.

Surprisingly, you‚Äôve just learned one of the greatest ‚Äúsecrets‚Äù of successful strength training: knowing how hard to train in your workouts.

Many people don‚Äôt work hard enough and wonder why nothing changes, and many others work too hard and wonder why they‚Äôre always stuck in a rut and hurting.

You now know how to thread this needle effectively.

Want connect-the-dots simple beginner, intermediate, or advanced strength training programs that put this technique into effective use?

Click the link below to pre-order Muscle for Life now:

‚áí www.legionathletics.com/muscle-for-life-book/

Go for it!

P.S. If you do pre-order the book, make sure to keep your email receipt because I‚Äôll be giving away thousands of dollars of glorious goodies, and there will be several ways to enter to win, including buying books, spreading the word, following me on social media, and more.

More details to come soon!

gts:
Myth 1- Oiling your hair prevents hairfall.

No it doesn‚Äôt, oiling has no effect on Hairfall. I‚Äôve not oiled my hair from past 8 years still i don‚Äôt have any HairfaLl till now. It does stimulate your hair follicles & hydrate the scalp and hair but that‚Äôs all.

Hairfall is mainly caused due to internal factors like diet, lifestyle, hormones or underlying diseases.

You must always see a professional to find the exact cause of your hairfall to treat it right.

Myth 2- Trimming your hair helps them grow faster.

No not at all. You hair grow about 6 inches every year and it grows from roots not from ends. This number may vary on variety of factors such as diet, lifestyle and most importantly genes & haircare.

Trimming is essentially important to maintain healthy hair free from any split ends and damage but that‚Äôs all. It has got Nothing to do with faster hair growth.

Myth 3- You should change your shampoo & conditioner every few months.

No, shampoo is basically a cleanser which just cleanse your scalp. Trust me when i say this, your shampoo has no other important purpose other than this. If you change your shampoo every few months you may worsen your hair.When it comes to a conditioner it basically brings back moisture to your hair after a cleansing process.

It helps keep your length hydrated and more manageable. Avoid using a conditioner on your scalp at any cost as it‚Äôs suppose to go just on the lengths of your hair.

Myth 4- Split ends can be repaired.

No they can never be repaired. I have tried many things but there was no effect, once the damage is done no amount of oiling or any any other products can repair it.

It‚Äôs like a permanent split in the shaft of your hair which can only be gotten rid of by cutting that end to expose the fresh and complete hair.

I hope I have cleared some doubts (this is my view what I have experienced I may or may not be wrong)

Do follow me on Instagram ‚Äî https://www.instagram.com/rashiisharmaa/

gts:
Monday Night Football picks and preview at Soldier Field.

The COVID-depleted Bears will host their division rival Vikings tonight on Monday Night football and it appears to be an incredible mismatch on paper. The already banged up Bears defense will be without their top 4 CBs and top 3 safeties on the depth chart. Minnesota looks like they‚Äôre getting healthier in their WR room with Adam Thielen possibly returning to join Justin Jefferson. So let‚Äôs get to some picks. If you haven‚Äôt signed up with DraftKings yet do so HERE and take advantage of their new sign-up offer.

OVER 46

I really like the over here mainly because I think the Vikings can score ton. If Mike Zimmer lets his team throw on this depleted Bears secondary, the Vikings should be able to put up a whole lot of points through the air. The Bears offense is mostly healthy, they haven‚Äôt been terrible the last few weeks and Minnesota‚Äôs defense has been prone to giving up 20+ points.

Justin Jefferson Anytime TD scorer (-105)

This one makes a whole lot of sense given the Bears secondary situation. Jefferson has spent most of this season tearing up top cornerbacks in the league, so the likes of Kindle Vildor or Duke Shelley likely won‚Äôt stand much of a chance. Not the greatest value but I like this at near even money.

Justin Fields OVER 203.5 Pass Yards

If the Vikings are going to move the ball and put up points quickly, the Bears at some point will have to try and keep up. Matt Nagy will probably stubbornly try to run the ball and control the time of possession, but once the Bears start to fall behind, they‚Äôll have to let Fields open things up and push the ball downfield.

Diabetes? Why Did No One Tell You About This? (Smart Blood Sugar)

Diabetes happens when your body isn‚Äôt able to take up sugar (glucose) into its cells and use it for energy. This results in a build up of extra sugar in your bloodstream.

Poorly controlled diabetes can lead to serious consequences, causing damage to a wide range of your body‚Äôs organs and tissues ‚Äî including your heart, kidneys, eyes and nerves.

Why is my blood glucose level high? How does this happen?

The process of digestion includes breaking down the food you eat into various different nutrient sources. When you eat carbohydrates (for example, bread, rice, pasta), your body breaks this down into sugar (glucose). When glucose is in your bloodstream, it needs help ‚Äî a ‚Äúkey‚Äù ‚Äî to get into its final destination where it‚Äôs used, which is inside your body‚Äôs cells (cells make up your body‚Äôs tissues and organs). This help or ‚Äúkey‚Äù is insulin.

Insulin is a hormone made by your pancreas, an organ located behind your stomach. Your pancreas releases insulin into your bloodstream. Insulin acts as the ‚Äúkey‚Äù that unlocks the cell wall ‚Äúdoor,‚Äù which allows glucose to enter your body‚Äôs cells. Glucose provides the ‚Äúfuel‚Äù or energy tissues and organs need to properly function.

If you have diabetes:

Your pancreas doesn‚Äôt make any insulin or enough insulin.

Or

Your pancreas makes insulin but your body‚Äôs cells don‚Äôt respond to it and can‚Äôt use it as it normally should.

If glucose can‚Äôt get into your body‚Äôs cells, it stays in your bloodstream and your blood glucose level rises.

gts:
Image credit: Shutterstock

University of New South Wales (Sydney): Engineers have demonstrated a way to help 3d printed plastic heal itself at room temperature using only standard Led lights for around one hour which causes a chemical reaction and fusion of the two broken pieces.

The researchers in the UNSW School of Chemical Engineering have shown that the addition of ‚Äúspecial powder‚Äù to the liquid resin used in the printing process can later assist with making quick and easy repairs should the material break.

The entire process makes the repaired plastic even stronger than it was before it was damaged, and it is hoped that further development and commercialisation of the technique will help to reduce chemical waste in the future.

That is because broken plastic parts would not need to be discarded, or even recycled, and could be mended simply even when remaining embedded in a component including many other materials.

Researchers says that the new technology could potentially be used in a range of applications where advanced 3D printed materials are currently used in high-tech specialized components. These include wearable electronics, sensors, and even some shoe manufacturing.

gts:
This is the first post of a three part series. Part 2 is here, and Part 3 is here. This was originally published as one post on Fueled‚Äôs blog.

Introduction

I was watching TV on my couch. Once again, the apartment‚Äôs temperature dropped to the point where my coldness outweighed my laziness. I got up and walked over to the heater to turn it on. Five minutes later, the apartment got too hot, so I walked over to turn the heater off. This was the process for controlling the temperature in my apartment. Until now.

End result: Flipping a switch with an remotely-controlled motor

End result: Close-up of motor position toggling switch

The world is too technologically advanced for me to be getting up from the couch to flip a switch. Surely, there‚Äôs a product out there that would solve this problem for me. The closest thing I could find was the SwitchBot, a stand alone box that presses a button. To turn my heater on and off, I would need two SwitchBots, one for each side of the toggle switch. After reading the product reviews, I was unsure if the SwitchBot would even have enough force to press the toggle switch. Ultimately, I decided against spending $60 on an imperfect solution, and to make something bespoke to my heater.

The heater‚Äôs control panel. The STOP/START switch is the one we need to toggle.

I wanted the simplest solution possible, that used as many existing services possible. I learned from past projects that the more custom things are involved, the more there is to maintain.

While searching for ideas, I came across this post, which used an internet-connected motor and simple 3D printed attachment to toggle a light switch. This was it! I‚Äôd do the same thing, but with a different 3D printed attachment.

I wanted to get started right away. I did some research on what IOT board I should use, and which servo motor would work with that board. Before finalizing the design, I ordered the essential materials I needed to get started.

Hey, sure! Here‚Äôs a draft:

Holistic dentistry is a philosophy that integrates oral health with overall wellness. At its core, it emphasizes the importance of maintaining a healthy mouth to support the body‚Äôs overall health. One key aspect of holistic dentistry is the oral-systemic link, which highlights the connection between oral health and systemic conditions. For example, gum disease has been linked to an increased risk of heart disease, stroke, and diabetes. By addressing oral health, holistic dentists aim to improve overall health.

In terms of practical examples, holistic dentistry focuses on using mercury-free fillings, natural materials, and preventive education. Mercury-free fillings are a safer alternative to traditional amalgam fillings, which contain mercury. Natural materials, such as composite resins, are biocompatible and can be used to restore teeth. Preventive education is crucial, as it empowers patients to make informed decisions about their oral health. This includes regular check-ups, proper brushing and flossing techniques, and dietary recommendations to promote a healthy mouth.

By incorporating these elements, holistic dentistry offers a comprehensive approach to oral health that not only improves the appearance and function of teeth but also supports overall wellness. I hope this gives you a good starting point!
</response>
gts:
Holistic dentistry, also referred to as conservative dentistry and biological dentistry is a form of preventive dental care that prioritizes the health and healing of your natural smile. This type of natural dentistry is focused on maintaining the strength and structure of the teeth and gums, by detecting damage early on and providing treatments that take into account your total-body health. In recent years, this type of dentistry has grown in popularity. Many people are attracted to its holistic approach, along with its use of more natural remedies.

Dentist explaining holistic dentistry approach to a patient at Northwest Natural Dentistry, Hayden ID

The Holistic dentist diagnoses and treats conditions like tooth decay, gum disease, tooth infection, enamel degradation, or dry mouth. Instead of focusing on dental cleaning, he offers education to encourage personal oral hygiene.

Unlike general dentists, holistic dentists do not favor the use of fluoride treatments. Instead of using amalgam materials for dental implants, they prefer to use biocompatible‚Äù or natural materials as Amalgams contain mercury, which may cause post-placement sensitivity. There is also a risk of bacteria remnants, which may lead to secondary dental surgery.

What is Holistic Dentistry?

Holistic dentistry treats oral problems by focusing on all aspects of health including your physical, emotional, and spiritual health. The philosophy behind holistic dentistry is:

Never treat when you can prevent or heal instead

When you must treat, provide technical excellence using minimally invasive methods and non-toxic materials

Employ safeguards to protect against exposure to known toxins, like mercury

Use treatments that stimulate the body‚Äôs natural ability to heal

How Does Holistic Dentistry Support Total-Body Health?

Optimal oral health promotes the health of your entire body. Poor oral health is associated with increased risk for more serious health conditions, including heart disease, obesity, and diabetes.

The holistic dentistry techniques are designed to protect not just your smile, but your whole body! Using top dental tools and technologies to deliver non-toxic, health-based treatments, the dentist can help identify potential dental problems early on.

If you prefer natural remedies or whole-health treatment for dental care that prioritizes your complete health with safe materials and effective treatments then Holistic dentistry is the right choice for you.

Samsung has been testing the One UI 4.0 beta for the Galaxy Z Fold 3 and Galaxy Z Flip 3 in select areas for a few weeks now. As a result, owners of Samsung‚Äôs latest foldables can now enjoy Android 12 One UI 4.0.

For the devices, the beta program is going well. The latest One UI 4.0 beta for the Galaxy Z Fold 3 and Galaxy Z Flip 3 has been released by Samsung. This indicates that the final version of the update may be available soon for these devices.

One UI 4.0 Beta

The ZUKG build is the Galaxy Z Fold 3 and Galaxy Z Flip 3‚Äôs third One UI 4.0 beta upgrade. It is currently being rolled out to users in South Korea. This release provides several enhancements, according to the changelog. A few bugs have also been addressed. Users will be able to easily carry out tasks such as remove contacts with this new update.

It‚Äôs worth mentioning that South Korea isn‚Äôt the only nation where Samsung‚Äôs new foldable phones can participate in the beta. It was recently made available to users in the United States by the corporation. However, the procedure for joining the beta remains the same.

Samsung has already issued the One UI 4.0 Android 12 upgrade for the Galaxy S21 series to the general public. The first lineup to receive the upgrade is this one. Other high-end Samsung handsets should receive the final One UI 4.0 update before the year‚Äôs conclusion.

gts:
On my wedding day, I weighed over 310 pounds.

Over the years, I‚Äôve dropped weight 15 to 25 pounds at a time. I‚Äôve used several different plans. But, these are the truths that have consistently worked the best in keeping the weight off.

Eliminate empty calories.

Sugar and alcohol provide no nutritional value. Eliminate all forms of added sugar, which includes desserts as well as condiments. Instead, choose foods that work with you towards your goal.

Eliminate flour from your diet.

Bread, crackers, desserts, and sauces all contain flour. They provide a sense of fullness to a meal. They also give a feeling of fullness to your belly, particularly the fat stored around your waist.

Eat 5 small balanced meals based on lean proteins and green leafy vegetables.

Balanced means a little of everything:

4‚Äì5 ounces of lean meat

1‚Äì2 cups of green, leafy vegetables

1/2 cup of grains.

Breakfast could be 1/2 cup of oats, 2 or 3 eggs, and 1/2 of blueberries. Lunch might be 4 oz of chicken breast, 1/2 cup of rice, and 2 cups of steamed green beans. Dinner would be 4 oz of sirloin and 2 cups of salad.

Eat 3 servings of whole grains earlier in the day.

Moving your grains into your earlier meals, and avoiding them for dinner, gives your body a chance to use the added energy throughout the day.

Eat 2 servings of fruit earlier in the day.

The ideal time for fruit is for breakfast and after a workout. Fruit provides an added energy boost with its natural sugars. However, take care not to overdo it.

Follow these 5 steps to eliminate your belly fat once and for all. Start with the top of the list to see the most significant immediate results.

Today, my weight is around 200 pounds. I intend to drop another 20 pounds to get to an ideal weight for my 6-foot frame.

Most homeowners buy leather furniture to add a touch of elegance to their homes. No one can deny that leather furniture sets are expensive and sophisticated that can make your home look chic and elegant. They are widely used in many offices, but now they are also a part of residences as long as you know how to spruce it up. Leather always comes in the right color and with the right accessories.

In addition, Leather can also make a home homier, but you need to take proper care of them. Well, in order to keep them in a good condition, you should never put them in a place where it gets a lot of sunlight as the UV rays can make the color fade as well as cause cracks and tears. Moreover, it will make the material look and feel older than it is. Thus always place them in a space where your leather furniture gets little to no sunlight. These are the basic things you should know about before using leather furniture in your home.

Professional Leather cleaning services-

Apart from the above mentioned things, you should also include an expert Leather cleaning service. Leather cleaning is an easy process and you need to be gentle with it to preserve its quality.

Most people think it is a DIY job. Remember leather is a delicate material and you must know that rubbing too strongly on it will easily cause cracks or tears when you are using soap. You can just wipe it with a moist cloth when there are spills or smudges. You can also get some leather cleaning solutions available in the market to take out stains faster.

At the same time, you must know that some kinds of lather require professional cleaning. This is where a professional team will help you.

Well, several companies are out there online and you can easily find the best source that caters to this service. Not all types of leather are the same and they need different treatments. So it is better to employ a professional and highly experienced team that can deal with it properly.

¬∑ Completes crutiny and examination of your leather

¬∑ Application of leather conditioner

¬∑ Application of leather protectant

¬∑ Detailed action plan for future cleaning and intermittent maintenance

2022 is supposed to be a big year for the NFT, gaming and metaverse sectors . Here are the top projects in those sectors according to the TechTimes.com website.

1. MetaFighter

MetaFighter is a fighting game with characters, abilities and arenas that can be upgraded and traded. Players earn FIGHT tokens to strengthen NFTs and sell them on the marketplace.

2. GameJam

GameJam is a blockchain platform that hosts and publishesblockchain games of all types and genres. GameJam is at the center of the emergence of innovative blockchain games in 2022.

3. NFT BAZL

NFT BAZL is a marketplace for NFT that brings together art, art workers and celebrities in one ecosystem. NFT BAZL has held performances in the city of Miami, USA and Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

NFT BAZL showcases works of art and collections from the world‚Äôs greatest artists and in the digital investment sector.

4. Origin Protocol

Origin Protocol is a new NFT platform that makes it easy to buy and sell NFT according to artist criteria with a flexible and personalized sales format.

The platform has partnered with top artists, including Paris Hilton, Ryan Tedder, Don Diablo, Jake Paul and others. Origin holds a private NFT exhibition at the Art Basel Miami 2021 event.

5. Blind Boxes

Blind Boxes is anNFT marketplace where users can pay a flat fee and receive one of several selected physical or digital collectibles. NFT is randomly distributed so that the user gets a surprise.

6. Monster Galaxy

Monster Galaxy is a play-to-earn (P2E) game where players can raise animals and fight. Monster Galaxy is a global brand with over 25 million players and 1.3 million followers on Facebook.

This game is backed by Animoca Brands, a successful venture capitalist in the P2E field. Monster Galaxy players can simultaneously become game owners by obtaining GGM tokens.

7. Whydah

Whydah is ablockchain gaming hubin Asia that is building anopen metaverse where users connect online. The company will raise US$25 million in 2021 through venture capitalists.

2022 is likely to be a lucrative year for blockchain, especially given the booming metaverse and the increasingly popular gaming and NFT sectors.

Can you provide more context on the role of human insulin in blood sugar control and any general advice for diabetes patients in Kuwait, including when they should consult specialists? I want to ensure the information is clear and medically accurate for a general audience.

gts:
Insulin is a hormone produced by the pancreas and has many important functions in the human body, especially in controlling blood sugar levels and preventing high blood sugar. Insulin is a hormone that helps transport sugar from the blood to the cells in the body.

Insulin allows your body to use the sugar (glucose) in carbohydrates for energy or store glucose for future use. The most important function of insulin in the human body is its interaction with glucose, and thereby it enables the cells in the body to use glucose as energy for daily chores.

The more glucose in the blood, the more insulin the pancreas secretes. For the glucose in the blood to enter the cells, the pancreas produces insulin, which sends signals to the cells in the body to absorb the sugar into the blood. For people without diabetes, the pancreas produces enough insulin to remove a sugar called glucose from the blood, into the cells, and use it as energy. However, diabetes affects this process, which is why some diabetics need extra insulin.

But if someone has diabetes, either the body cannot produce insulin, or insulin does not work properly in the body. If you don‚Äôt have enough insulin, glucose builds up in your bloodstream instead of supplying energy to your body. In the absence of insulin, the body cannot use glucose as energy in cells. This is when you have to consult the diabetes doctors in Kuwait .

The World Health Organization guidelines recommend human insulin products for patients with type 1 diabetes who need cheap insulin options. Regular Human Insulin is used in conjunction with a proper diet and exercise program to help control high blood sugar levels in diabetic patients. Insulin is a hormone that regulates the amount of glucose (sugar) in the blood and is necessary for the normal functioning of the body.

gts:
By elle.fr

The majority of us are enamored with long, wavy beach hair that we have imagined as the ideal hairstyle! How do we achieve such long and gorgeous hair? I‚Äôll let you know how.

After some time and numerous tests with my hair, including making homemade masks, purchasing chemical treatments, consuming vitamins, and taking tablets, I finally discovered the best remedy for me.

I had long, lovely hair till I chopped it off a year ago. The reason for my action was that I was bored of my sun-damaged, lifeless, damaged, and broken hair, which did not appear to ever come back in the correct state.

So, to address the situation, I utilized the scissors. My hair was trimmed in a long A-bob side. The style looked great on me, and I felt like a whole new person.

But the good vibes didn‚Äôt last long. After a while, I began to miss my long hair, so I began Googling and clicking on any link on the internet that promised long hair.

The Best Kept Not-So Secret? Olive Oil!

Stay with your head down, for about 4 minutes after applying the olive oil along the length of your hair. The reason for this is that blood will circulate more freely through your head‚Äôs epidermis, making it easier for your hair to absorb all of the nutrients.

After that, cover the mask with a cloth and let it on for around 30 minutes. If you can stand it, sleep with the mask on your head, but wear a shower cap and place a towel on your pillow. When you get out of the shower, give it a good shampoo to get rid of all the oil and apply conditioner as usual.

The towel should not be used to rub the hair because it will cause breaking.

If you need more tips and tricks, or why this process works, you can read here: https://discover.hubpages.com/style/How-to-grow-you-hair-longer

This hydrogen peroxide can break down harmful algae and other organic matter. During decomposition, the shift from bacteria to fungi can further enhance the cleaning process.
